abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Run Away  allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like  Mean Look  or  Bind , or has an ability such as  Arena Trap . Pokémon with  Run Away  cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

abilities.name: Sniper
abilities.description: Sniper  increases the power of critical hits by 1.5×. This means a critical hit will deal  2.25×  normal damage instead of 1.5×. In  Generations 1-5  critical hits deal 2× normal damage, so  Sniper  inflicts  3×  normal damage.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: Guts  raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Static  is hit by a move making contact, there is a 30% chance the foe will become paralyzed. If a Pokémon with  Static  is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be  Electric  type.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: Lightning Rod  forces all single-target  Electric -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move  Thunder Wave . The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Lightning Rod  will activate for an Electric-type  Hidden Power , but not Electric-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generations 3-4 ,  Lightning Rod  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power . In  Generations 3-5 , this ability's name was formatted as  Lightningrod .

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability  Oblivious . Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being  immobilized by love  each turn and unable to attack. If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is  2 ⁄ 3 .

abilities.name: Magic Guard
abilities.description: Magic Guard  protects the Pokémon from indirect damage, including: It does not prevent damage from confusion, trapping moves (e.g.  Bind ) or  Struggle . In  Generation 4  a Pokémon with  Magic Guard  cannot be poisoned from  Toxic Spikes , nor become fully immobile through paralysis (though the Speed drop still occurs).

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with  Flash Fire  is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.

abilities.name: Drought
abilities.description: Drought  creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  Air Lock  or  Cloud Nine  or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities ( Drought ,  Drizzle ,  Sand Stream  or  Snow Warning ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to  Generation 6 ,  Drought  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Arena Trap
abilities.description: Arena Trap  prevents opponents from fleeing or switching out.  Raised  Pokémon are not affected. Raised Pokémon are any  Flying  types or those under the effects of  Levitate ,  Magnet Rise  or  Telekinesis . Full details in  glossary . If a Pokémon with  Arena Trap  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear. No Pokémon have  Arena Trap  as a hidden ability.

If a Pokémon with  Arena Trap  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear. No Pokémon have  Arena Trap  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with  Pickup  will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again. Pokémon with  Pickup  will also obtain an item thrown at them with  Fling  (if they are not already holding anything). In  Generations 3-4 ,  Pickup  has no effect in battle. When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with  Pickup  has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item). Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

abilities.name: Technician
abilities.description: Technician  increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%. Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if  Magnitude  hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power. Moves like  Sonic Boom  that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by  Technician .

abilities.description: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with  Synchronize , the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on. In  Generations 3-4 , bad poison is only passed on as regular poison. If a Pokémon with  Synchronize  is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature. No Pokémon have  Synchronize  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: Guts  raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

abilities.name: No Guard
abilities.description: No Guard  ensures that all attacks used by, and targeted at, the ability-bearer hit without fail. This includes moves used on a Pokémon in the  hidden  stages of the moves  Fly ,  Dive ,  Dig  and  Shadow Force . If a Pokémon with  No Guard  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: Sturdy  allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). If  Sturdy  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as  Fury Swipes ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy  does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as  Selfdestruct ,  Explosion  and  Final Gambit .

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Run Away  allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like  Mean Look  or  Bind , or has an ability such as  Arena Trap . Pokémon with  Run Away  cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: Lightning Rod  forces all single-target  Electric -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move  Thunder Wave . The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Lightning Rod  will activate for an Electric-type  Hidden Power , but not Electric-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generations 3-4 ,  Lightning Rod  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power . In  Generations 3-5 , this ability's name was formatted as  Lightningrod .

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: Serene Grace  doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items  King's Rock  and  Razor Fang  from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance). Serene Grace  does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio. Shadow Ball  normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 40% chance. Air Slash  has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item  King's Rock  is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from  King's Rock . This means  Serene Grace  with  Air Slash  and  King's Rock  gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch. In  Generations 3-4   Serene Grace  does not increase the flinch chance of  King's Rock  or Razor Fang. In  Generations 3-5   Serene Grace  does not affect the move  Secret Power .

abilities.name: Soundproof
abilities.description: Soundproof  grants the Pokémon immunity to all  sound-based  moves, preventing all damage and effects. In  Generation 5  only, Pokémon with  Soundproof  could be cured of status conditions by  Heal Bell .

abilities.name: Filter
abilities.description: Filter  reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. For example, a Dark-type move used against a Psychic-type Pokémon with  Filter  would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.

abilities.name: Swarm
abilities.description: Swarm  increases the power of  Bug -type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as  in a pinch ). If a Pokémon with  Swarm  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Technician
abilities.description: Technician  increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%. Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if  Magnitude  hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power. Moves like  Sonic Boom  that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by  Technician .

abilities.name: Oblivious
abilities.description: Oblivious  makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically  Attract ,  Captivate  and  Cute Charm .

abilities.name: Forewarn
abilities.description:
Determines what moves a foe has.
 No Pokémon have  Forewarn  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Static  is hit by a move making contact, there is a 30% chance the foe will become paralyzed. If a Pokémon with  Static  is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be  Electric  type.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: Vital Spirit  prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move  Rest . If a Pokémon with  Vital Spirit  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Flame Body  is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned. If a Pokémon with  Flame Body  (or  Magma Armor  or  Steam Engine ) and a  Pokémon Egg  are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: Vital Spirit  prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move  Rest . If a Pokémon with  Vital Spirit  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Hyper Cutter
abilities.description: Hyper Cutter  prevents the bearer's Attack stat from being lowered by other Pokémon, through moves such as  Growl  or abilities such as  Intimidate . It does not prevent self-inflicted decreases, for example from  Superpower . No Pokémon have  Hyper Cutter  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Mold Breaker
abilities.description: Mold Breaker  prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the  Mold Breaker  Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves. For example, a  Haxorus  with  Mold Breaker  would be able to hit a  Bronzong  (having  Levitate ) using a Ground type move like  Earthquake . Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types. However, if  Dragon Claw  KOs a Pokémon with  Aftermath , a  Mold Breaker  Pokémon would still lose HP as Aftermath did not affect the  Dragon Claw  attack itself.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: Intimidate  lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle). Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. If a Pokémon with  Intimidate  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

abilities.name: Anger Point
abilities.description: Anger Point  raises the ability-bearer's Attack to its maximum level - +6 stages or 4× usual power - when a move targeting it receives a critical hit.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Swift Swim  doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during  rain .

abilities.name: Rattled

abilities.name: Moxie
abilities.description: Moxie  increases the user's Attack one stage upon fainting an opponent. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Water Absorb  heals  1 ⁄ 4  of its maximum HP when hit by a  Water -type attack.

abilities.name: Shell Armor

abilities.name: Limber

abilities.name: Imposter

It transforms itself into the Pokémon it is facing.
 No Pokémon have the ability  Imposter  as a regular ability.

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Water Absorb  heals  1 ⁄ 4  of its maximum HP when hit by a  Water -type attack.

abilities.name: Hydration
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Hydration  will cure itself of any status conditions during rain, at the end of each turn. This includes self-inflicted conditions such as from using  Rest .

abilities.name: Volt Absorb
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Volt Absorb  heals  1 ⁄ 4  of its maximum HP when hit by an  Electric -type attack, including  Thunder Wave . In  Generation 3 ,  Volt Absorb  does not activate for  Thunder Wave .

abilities.name: Quick Feet
abilities.description: Quick Feet  raises the ability-bearer's Speed by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If paralyzed, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Speed. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep). If a Pokémon with  Quick Feet  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with  Flash Fire  is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: Guts  raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

abilities.name: Trace
abilities.description:
The Pokémon copies a foe's Ability.
 No Pokémon have  Trace  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Download
abilities.description: Download  raises either the bearer's Attack or Special Attack by one stage when switching into battle, base on the opponent's defenses. It raises Attack if the opponent's Defense is lower than its Special Defense, or raises Special Attack if opponent's Special Defense is lower than or equal to its Defense. In double and triple battles,  Download  compares the sum of all opponents' Defense stats and the sum of all opponents' Special Defense stats and uses the lowest total. No Pokémon have  Download  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with  Synchronize , the opponent receives the status condition too. abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Sheer Force  increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects. Beneficial  effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as: Non-beneficial effects, that  Sheer Force  will not activate for, include: If the user is holding a  Life Orb  and uses an attack that activates  Sheer Force , it will not receive the 10% damage from  Life Orb , but it gets boosts from both  Life Orb  and  Sheer Force  (total of 69% base power increase). Flamethrower  normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With  Sheer Force , Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn. Note that if a move has an advantageous  and  disadvantageous side-effect,  Sheer Force  still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example,  Flare Blitz  may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with  Sheer Force  using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn. Here are the moves that increase in power under  Sheer Force , listed alphabetically:

Pokémon with  Run Away  cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: Lightning Rod  forces all single-target  Electric -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move  Thunder Wave . The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Lightning Rod  will activate for an Electric-type  Hidden Power , but not Electric-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generations 3-4 ,  Lightning Rod  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power . In  Generations 3-5 , this ability's name was formatted as  Lightningrod .

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability  Oblivious . Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being  immobilized by love  each turn and unable to attack. If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is  2 ⁄ 3 .

abilities.name: Magic Guard
abilities.description: Magic Guard  protects the Pokémon from indirect damage, including: It does not prevent damage from confusion, trapping moves (e.g.  Bind ) or  Struggle . In  Generation 4  a Pokémon with  Magic Guard  cannot be poisoned from  Toxic Spikes , nor become fully immobile through paralysis (though the Speed drop still occurs).

abilities.name: Cute Charm

Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being  immobilized by love  each turn and unable to attack. If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is  2 ⁄ 3 .

abilities.name: Competitive
abilities.description: Competitive  raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

abilities.name: Hustle
abilities.description: Hustle  increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%. If a Pokémon with  Hustle  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: Serene Grace  doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items  King's Rock  and  Razor Fang  from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance). Serene Grace  does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio. Shadow Ball  normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 40% chance. Air Slash  has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item  King's Rock  is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from  King's Rock . This means  Serene Grace  with  Air Slash  and  King's Rock  gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch. In  Generations 3-4   Serene Grace  does not increase the flinch chance of  King's Rock  or Razor Fang. In  Generations 3-5   Serene Grace  does not affect the move  Secret Power .

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with  Synchronize , the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on. In  Generations 3-4 , bad poison is only passed on as regular poison. If a Pokémon with  Synchronize  is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature. No Pokémon have  Synchronize  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: Sturdy  allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). If  Sturdy  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as  Fury Swipes ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy  does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as  Selfdestruct ,  Explosion  and  Final Gambit .

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Run Away  allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like  Mean Look  or  Bind , or has an ability such as  Arena Trap . Pokémon with  Run Away  cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with  Pickup  will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again. Pokémon with  Pickup  will also obtain an item thrown at them with  Fling  (if they are not already holding anything). In  Generations 3-4 ,  Pickup  has no effect in battle. When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with  Pickup  has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item). Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

abilities.description: Hustle  increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%. If a Pokémon with  Hustle  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Swift Swim  doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during  rain .

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Water Absorb  heals  1 ⁄ 4  of its maximum HP when hit by a  Water -type attack.

abilities.name: Keen Eye
abilities.description: Keen Eye  prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like  Sand-Attack . If a Pokémon with  Keen Eye  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: Sturdy  allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). If  Sturdy  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as  Fury Swipes ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy  does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as  Selfdestruct ,  Explosion  and  Final Gambit .

abilities.name: Early Bird
abilities.description: The Pokémon awakens quickly from sleep.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with  Flash Fire  is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with  Flash Fire  is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Swift Swim  doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during  rain .

abilities.name: Sniper
abilities.description: Sniper  increases the power of critical hits by 1.5×. This means a critical hit will deal  2.25×  normal damage instead of 1.5×. In  Generations 1-5  critical hits deal 2× normal damage, so  Sniper  inflicts  3×  normal damage.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with  Pickup  will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again. Pokémon with  Pickup  will also obtain an item thrown at them with  Fling  (if they are not already holding anything). In  Generations 3-4 ,  Pickup  has no effect in battle. When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with  Pickup  has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item). Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

abilities.name: Sand Veil
abilities.description: Sand Veil  raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a  sandstorm . It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being  Ground / Rock / Steel  type). If a Pokémon with  Sand Veil  is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Trace
abilities.description:
The Pokémon copies a foe's Ability.
 No Pokémon have  Trace  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Download
abilities.description: Download  raises either the bearer's Attack or Special Attack by one stage when switching into battle, base on the opponent's defenses. It raises Attack if the opponent's Defense is lower than its Special Defense, or raises Special Attack if opponent's Special Defense is lower than or equal to its Defense. In double and triple battles,  Download  compares the sum of all opponents' Defense stats and the sum of all opponents' Special Defense stats and uses the lowest total. No Pokémon have  Download  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: Intimidate  lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle). Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. If a Pokémon with  Intimidate  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

abilities.name: Frisk
abilities.description: The Pokémon can check a foe's held item.

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.

abilities.name: Technician
abilities.description: Technician  increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%. Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if  Magnitude  hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power. Moves like  Sonic Boom  that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by  Technician .

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: Guts  raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

abilities.name: Steadfast
abilities.description: Raises Speed each time the Pokémon flinches.

abilities.name: Static

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: Vital Spirit  prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move  Rest . If a Pokémon with  Vital Spirit  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Flame Body  is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned. If a Pokémon with  Flame Body  (or  Magma Armor  or  Steam Engine ) and a  Pokémon Egg  are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: Vital Spirit  prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move  Rest . If a Pokémon with  Vital Spirit  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.description: Thick Fat  reduces the damage taken from  Fire -type and  Ice -type moves by 50%. Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A  Dewgong  or  Walrein  with  Thick Fat  would take  1 ⁄ 8  normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.

abilities.name: Scrappy
abilities.description: Enables moves to hit Ghost-type Pokémon.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.description: All status problems heal when it switches out.

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: Serene Grace  doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items  King's Rock  and  Razor Fang  from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance). Serene Grace  does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio. Shadow Ball  normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 40% chance. Air Slash  has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item  King's Rock  is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from  King's Rock . This means  Serene Grace  with  Air Slash  and  King's Rock  gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch. In  Generations 3-4   Serene Grace  does not increase the flinch chance of  King's Rock  or Razor Fang. In  Generations 3-5   Serene Grace  does not affect the move  Secret Power .

If a Pokémon with  Truant  uses a move that requires recharging on the second turn (such as  Hyper Beam ), it will recharge on the same turn the Pokémon loafs around. Moves where the user prepares on the first turn and attacks on the second (such as  Solarbeam  or  Fly ) cannot be used. The moves  Worry Seed ,  Entrainment  and  Simple Beam  do not work on Pokémon with  Truant . Truant  can technically be  Skill Swapped  away, however neither Slakoth, Slaking or Durant learn it.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: Vital Spirit  prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move  Rest . If a Pokémon with  Vital Spirit  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Truant
abilities.description: Truant  causes the ability-bearer to only attack every alternate turn. On the even turns, it will say the Pokémon is  loafing around . If a Pokémon with  Truant  uses a move that requires recharging on the second turn (such as  Hyper Beam ), it will recharge on the same turn the Pokémon loafs around. Moves where the user prepares on the first turn and attacks on the second (such as  Solarbeam  or  Fly ) cannot be used. The moves  Worry Seed ,  Entrainment  and  Simple Beam  do not work on Pokémon with  Truant . Truant  can technically be  Skill Swapped  away, however neither Slakoth, Slaking or Durant learn it.

abilities.name: Compound Eyes
abilities.description: Compound Eyes  raises the ability-bearer's accuracy by 30%. In  Generations 3-5 , this ability's name was formatted as  Compoundeyes . If a Pokémon with  Compound Eyes  is first in the party, Pokémon that can be holding items have that chance increase from 50% to 60% (for common items), 5% to 20% (for uncommon items) or 1% to 5% (for rare items).

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Run Away  allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like  Mean Look  or  Bind , or has an ability such as  Arena Trap . Pokémon with  Run Away  cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

abilities.name: Speed Boost
abilities.description: Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.

abilities.name: Infiltrator
abilities.description: Infiltrator  ignores the effects of  Reflect ,  Light Screen  and  Safeguard . In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard,  Toxic  would still badly poison them.

abilities.name: Wonder Guard
abilities.description: Wonder Guard  prevents damage from direct attacks unless they are super-effective. Shedinja is the only Pokémon to have this ability so this means that only  Fire ,  Flying ,  Rock ,  Ghost  and  Dark  moves will have an effect. However, Pokémon protected by  Wonder Guard  are not immune to indirect attacks. Status-category moves still work and all end-of-turn damage will still incur, for example from poisoning, burns, sandstorms or hail. Entry hazards such as  Spikes  or  Stealth Rock  will also damage Pokémon with  Wonder Guard  switching in. Attacks that do not take their type in account will also hit, such as  Struggle ,  Beat Up  or  Future Sight . Since Shedinja only has 1 HP, any of the above damage will result in an instant knockout. No Pokémon have  Wonder Guard  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Soundproof
abilities.description: Soundproof  grants the Pokémon immunity to all  sound-based  moves, preventing all damage and effects. In  Generation 5  only, Pokémon with  Soundproof  could be cured of status conditions by  Heal Bell .

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.description: Thick Fat  reduces the damage taken from  Fire -type and  Ice -type moves by 50%. Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A  Dewgong  or  Walrein  with  Thick Fat  would take  1 ⁄ 8  normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: Guts  raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

abilities.name: Huge Power
abilities.description: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: Sturdy  allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). If  Sturdy  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as  Fury Swipes ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy  does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as  Selfdestruct ,  Explosion  and  Final Gambit .

abilities.name: Magnet Pull
abilities.description: Magnet Pull  prevents  Steel  type Pokémon from switching out of battle or fleeing. If a Pokémon with  Magnet Pull  is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be  Steel  type. No Pokémon have  Magnet Pull  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability  Oblivious . Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being  immobilized by love  each turn and unable to attack. If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is  2 ⁄ 3 .

abilities.name: Normalize
abilities.description: Normalize  causes all moves used by the Pokémon to become  Normal -type, and attacking moves increase in power by 20%. Normal-type Pokémon also gain  STAB  from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%). The following moves are not affected by  Normalize :  Hidden Power ,  Judgment ,  Multi-Attack ,  Natural Gift ,  Revelation Dance ,  Struggle ,  Techno Blast ,  Weather Ball , and damaging Z-Moves. The move  Flying Press  deals Normal/Flying type damage instead of Fighting/Flying.  Freeze-Dry  remains super-effective against Water-types, but follows the Normal type chart against other types (e.g. neutral against Grass-types). In  Generations 4-6 ,  Normalize  did not increase damage (besides any usual boosts like  STAB ). All moves listed above except Struggle  are  affected by  Normalize . No Pokémon have  Normalize  as a hidden ability.

abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Static  is hit by a move making contact, there is a 30% chance the foe will become paralyzed. If a Pokémon with  Static  is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be  Electric  type.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: Lightning Rod  forces all single-target  Electric -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move  Thunder Wave . The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Lightning Rod  will activate for an Electric-type  Hidden Power , but not Electric-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generations 3-4 ,  Lightning Rod  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power . In  Generations 3-5 , this ability's name was formatted as  Lightningrod .

abilities.name: Simple
abilities.description: The  Simple  ability doubles the number of stages of all stat changes. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. For example, using  Swords Dance  would increase the Pokémon's attack by 4 stages instead of the usual 2. If  Tail Whip  was targeted at a Pokémon with  Simple , its Defense would drop 2 stages instead of 1. The move  Simple Beam  can change a Pokémon's ability to  Simple . In  Generation 4 ,  Simple  doubles the effects of stat changes but does not increase the actual number of stages. Stat increases are capped at the same multiplier of ×4, as per the table below. However, the resulting effect is exactly the same as current games.

abilities.name: Magma Armor
abilities.description: Magma Armor  prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen, for example from moves like  Blizzard . If a Pokémon with  Magma Armor  (or  Flame Body  or  Steam Engine ) and a  Pokémon Egg  are amongst the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved. No Pokémon have  Magma Armor  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Solid Rock
abilities.description: Solid Rock  reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. For example, a Water-type move used against a Rock-type Pokémon with  Solid Rock  would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×. No Pokémon have  Solid Rock  as a hidden ability.

 If a Pokémon with  White Smoke  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Drought
abilities.description: Drought  creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  Air Lock  or  Cloud Nine  or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities ( Drought ,  Drizzle ,  Sand Stream  or  Snow Warning ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to  Generation 6 ,  Drought  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Suction Cups
abilities.description: Suction Cups  prevents opponents forcing the ability-bearer to switch out or flee via the moves  Roar ,  Whirlwind ,  Circle Throw , or  Dragon Tail , or the item  Red Card . If a Pokémon with  Suction Cups  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases. No Pokémon have  Suction Cups  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Storm Drain
abilities.description: Storm Drain  forces all single-target  Water -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Storm Drain  will activate for an Water-type  Hidden Power , but not Water-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generation 4 ,  Storm Drain  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Water-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power .

abilities.name: Color Change
abilities.description: Color Change  changes the ability-bearer's type, when hit by a damage dealing move, to the type of that move. For example being hit by  X Scissor  will change the Pokémon to  Bug -type. Dual-type Pokémon change to single-types. If a Pokémon with  Color Change  has a  Substitute , the ability does not activate.  Color Change  activates for the last strike of a multi-hit move. In  Generations 3-4 ,  Color Change  activates on the first strike of a multi-hit move, thus subsequent hits may be not very effective. No Pokémon have  Color Change  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Protean

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Sheer Force  increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects. Beneficial  effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as: Non-beneficial effects, that  Sheer Force  will not activate for, include: If the user is holding a  Life Orb  and uses an attack that activates  Sheer Force , it will not receive the 10% damage from  Life Orb , but it gets boosts from both  Life Orb  and  Sheer Force  (total of 69% base power increase). Flamethrower  normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With  Sheer Force , Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn. Note that if a move has an advantageous  and  disadvantageous side-effect,  Sheer Force  still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example,  Flare Blitz  may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with  Sheer Force  using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn. Here are the moves that increase in power under  Sheer Force , listed alphabetically:

abilities.name: Drizzle
abilities.description: Drizzle  creates a rain shower when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  Air Lock  or  Cloud Nine  or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities ( Drizzle ,  Drought ,  Sand Stream  or  Snow Warning ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to  Generation 6 ,  Drizzle  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Primordial Sea
abilities.description: Primordial Sea  creates heavy rain when the ability is activated (by Kyogre reverting to its Primal form). Heavy rain has the same effects as  regular rain  but with some additions: The abilities  Cloud Nine  or  Air Lock  are still able to bypass the effects of  Primordial Sea , but  Mold Breaker  is not. No Pokémon have  Primordial Sea  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Drought
abilities.description: Drought  creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  Air Lock  or  Cloud Nine  or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities ( Drought ,  Drizzle ,  Sand Stream  or  Snow Warning ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to  Generation 6 ,  Drought  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Desolate Land
abilities.description: Desolate Land  creates extremely harsh sunlight when the ability is activated (by Groudon reverting to its Primal form). Extremely harsh sunlight has the same effects as  harsh sunlight  but with some additions: The abilities  Cloud Nine  or  Air Lock  are still able to bypass the effects of  Desolate Land , but  Mold Breaker  is not. No Pokémon have  Desolate Land  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Air Lock
abilities.description: Air Lock  suppresses  all  effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on. No Pokémon have  Air Lock  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Delta Stream
abilities.description: Delta Stream  creates strong winds when the ability is activated (by Rayquaza Mega-Evolving). Strong winds have the following effects: The abilities  Cloud Nine  or  Air Lock  are still able to bypass the effects of  Delta Stream , but  Mold Breaker  is not. No Pokémon have  Delta Stream  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: Serene Grace  doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items  King's Rock  and  Razor Fang  from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance). Serene Grace  does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio. Shadow Ball  normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 40% chance. Air Slash  has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item  King's Rock  is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from  King's Rock . This means  Serene Grace  with  Air Slash  and  King's Rock  gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch. In  Generations 3-4   Serene Grace  does not increase the flinch chance of  King's Rock  or Razor Fang. In  Generations 3-5   Serene Grace  does not affect the move  Secret Power .

abilities.name: Simple
abilities.description: The  Simple  ability doubles the number of stages of all stat changes. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. For example, using  Swords Dance  would increase the Pokémon's attack by 4 stages instead of the usual 2. If  Tail Whip  was targeted at a Pokémon with  Simple , its Defense would drop 2 stages instead of 1. The move  Simple Beam  can change a Pokémon's ability to  Simple . In  Generation 4 ,  Simple  doubles the effects of stat changes but does not increase the actual number of stages. Stat increases are capped at the same multiplier of ×4, as per the table below. However, the resulting effect is exactly the same as current games.

abilities.name: Technician
abilities.description: Technician  increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%. Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if  Magnitude  hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power. Moves like  Sonic Boom  that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by  Technician .

abilities.name: Rivalry
abilities.description: Deals more damage to a Pokémon of same gender.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: Intimidate  lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle). Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. If a Pokémon with  Intimidate  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

abilities.name: Mold Breaker
abilities.description: Mold Breaker  prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the  Mold Breaker  Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves. For example, a  Haxorus  with  Mold Breaker  would be able to hit a  Bronzong  (having  Levitate ) using a Ground type move like  Earthquake . Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types. However, if  Dragon Claw  KOs a Pokémon with  Aftermath , a  Mold Breaker  Pokémon would still lose HP as Aftermath did not affect the  Dragon Claw  attack itself.

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Sheer Force  increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects. Beneficial  effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as: Non-beneficial effects, that  Sheer Force  will not activate for, include: If the user is holding a  Life Orb  and uses an attack that activates  Sheer Force , it will not receive the 10% damage from  Life Orb , but it gets boosts from both  Life Orb  and  Sheer Force  (total of 69% base power increase). Flamethrower  normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With  Sheer Force , Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn. Note that if a move has an advantageous  and  disadvantageous side-effect,  Sheer Force  still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example,  Flare Blitz  may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with  Sheer Force  using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn. Here are the moves that increase in power under  Sheer Force , listed alphabetically:

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: Sturdy  allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). If  Sturdy  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as  Fury Swipes ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy  does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as  Selfdestruct ,  Explosion  and  Final Gambit .

abilities.name: Soundproof
abilities.description: Soundproof  grants the Pokémon immunity to all  sound-based  moves, preventing all damage and effects. In  Generation 5  only, Pokémon with  Soundproof  could be cured of status conditions by  Heal Bell .

abilities.name: Anticipation
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Anticipation  will  shudder  upon entering battle, if an opponent has a move that is super-effective against it, or a One-Hit-KO move ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). It only activates when the ability-bearer switches in, not when an opponent switches in. Anticipation  does not activate if the opponent has a move that varies in type, such as  Hidden Power ,  Judgment  or  Weather Ball , even if those moves would be super-effective.

abilities.description: Hustle  increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%. If a Pokémon with  Hustle  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Pressure  makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1. If a Pokémon with  Pressure  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Run Away
abilities.description: Run Away  allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like  Mean Look  or  Bind , or has an ability such as  Arena Trap . Pokémon with  Run Away  cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with  Pickup  will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again. Pokémon with  Pickup  will also obtain an item thrown at them with  Fling  (if they are not already holding anything). In  Generations 3-4 ,  Pickup  has no effect in battle. When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with  Pickup  has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item). Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

abilities.name: Storm Drain
abilities.description: Storm Drain  forces all single-target  Water -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Storm Drain  will activate for an Water-type  Hidden Power , but not Water-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generation 4 ,  Storm Drain  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Water-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power .

abilities.description: Filter  reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. For example, a Dark-type move used against a Psychic-type Pokémon with  Filter  would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×.

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: Serene Grace  doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items  King's Rock  and  Razor Fang  from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance). Serene Grace  does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio. Shadow Ball  normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 40% chance. Air Slash  has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item  King's Rock  is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from  King's Rock . This means  Serene Grace  with  Air Slash  and  King's Rock  gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch. In  Generations 3-4   Serene Grace  does not increase the flinch chance of  King's Rock  or Razor Fang. In  Generations 3-5   Serene Grace  does not affect the move  Secret Power .

abilities.name: Sand Stream
abilities.description: Sand Stream  creates a sandstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  Air Lock  or  Cloud Nine  or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities ( Sand Stream ,  Drizzle ,  Drought  or  Snow Warning ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to  Generation 6 ,  Sand Stream  lasts indefinitely upon activation. No Pokémon have  Sand Stream  as a hidden ability.

Anticipation  does not activate if the opponent has a move that varies in type, such as  Hidden Power ,  Judgment  or  Weather Ball , even if those moves would be super-effective.

abilities.name: Swift Swim
abilities.description: Swift Swim  doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during  rain .

abilities.name: Storm Drain
abilities.description: Storm Drain  forces all single-target  Water -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Storm Drain  will activate for an Water-type  Hidden Power , but not Water-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generation 4 ,  Storm Drain  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Water-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power .

abilities.name: Water Absorb
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Water Absorb  heals  1 ⁄ 4  of its maximum HP when hit by a  Water -type attack.

abilities.name: Snow Warning
abilities.description: Snow Warning  creates a hailstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  Air Lock  or  Cloud Nine  or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities ( Snow Warning ,  Drizzle ,  Drought  or  Sand Stream ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to  Generation 6 ,  Snow Warning  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Soundproof
abilities.description: Soundproof  grants the Pokémon immunity to all  sound-based  moves, preventing all damage and effects. In  Generation 5  only, Pokémon with  Soundproof  could be cured of status conditions by  Heal Bell .

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Pressure  makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1. If a Pokémon with  Pressure  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Pickpocket
abilities.description: Steals an item when hit by another Pokémon.

abilities.name: Magnet Pull
abilities.description: Magnet Pull  prevents  Steel  type Pokémon from switching out of battle or fleeing. If a Pokémon with  Magnet Pull  is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be  Steel  type. No Pokémon have  Magnet Pull  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: Sturdy  allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). If  Sturdy  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as  Fury Swipes ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy  does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as  Selfdestruct ,  Explosion  and  Final Gambit .

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.description: Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.

abilities.name: Oblivious
abilities.description: Oblivious  makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically  Attract ,  Captivate  and  Cute Charm .

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: Lightning Rod  forces all single-target  Electric -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move  Thunder Wave . The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Lightning Rod  will activate for an Electric-type  Hidden Power , but not Electric-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generations 3-4 ,  Lightning Rod  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power . In  Generations 3-5 , this ability's name was formatted as  Lightningrod .

abilities.name: Solid Rock
abilities.description: Solid Rock  reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. For example, a Water-type move used against a Rock-type Pokémon with  Solid Rock  would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×. No Pokémon have  Solid Rock  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.description: Chlorophyll  doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during  bright sunshine .

abilities.name: Leaf Guard
abilities.description: Leaf Guard  prevents the bearer from succumbing to major status ailments (sleep, burns, poisoning, paralysis or freezing) during sunny weather. It does not prevent minor status ailments such as Confusion or Infatuation, nor does it prevent self-inflicted status conditions such as from using  Rest .

abilities.name: Motor Drive
abilities.description: Raises Speed if hit by an Electric-type move.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: Vital Spirit  prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move  Rest . If a Pokémon with  Vital Spirit  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Flame Body  is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned. If a Pokémon with  Flame Body  (or  Magma Armor  or  Steam Engine ) and a  Pokémon Egg  are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: Vital Spirit  prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move  Rest . If a Pokémon with  Vital Spirit  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Hustle
abilities.description: Hustle  increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%. If a Pokémon with  Hustle  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: Serene Grace  doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items  King's Rock  and  Razor Fang  from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance). Serene Grace  does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio. Shadow Ball  normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 40% chance. Air Slash  has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with  Serene Grace  it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item  King's Rock  is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from  King's Rock . This means  Serene Grace  with  Air Slash  and  King's Rock  gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch. In  Generations 3-4   Serene Grace  does not increase the flinch chance of  King's Rock  or Razor Fang. In  Generations 3-5   Serene Grace  does not affect the move  Secret Power .

abilities.name: Download
abilities.description: Download  raises either the bearer's Attack or Special Attack by one stage when switching into battle, base on the opponent's defenses. It raises Attack if the opponent's Defense is lower than its Special Defense, or raises Special Attack if opponent's Special Defense is lower than or equal to its Defense. In double and triple battles,  Download  compares the sum of all opponents' Defense stats and the sum of all opponents' Special Defense stats and uses the lowest total. No Pokémon have  Download  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Forewarn
abilities.description:
Determines what moves a foe has.
 No Pokémon have  Forewarn  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with  Synchronize , the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on. In  Generations 3-4 , bad poison is only passed on as regular poison. If a Pokémon with  Synchronize  is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature. No Pokémon have  Synchronize  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Lightning Rod
abilities.description: Lightning Rod  forces all single-target  Electric -type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move  Thunder Wave . The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Lightning Rod  will activate for an Electric-type  Hidden Power , but not Electric-type  Judgment . The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the  center of attention  from the moves  Follow Me  or  Rage Powder . In  Generations 3-4 ,  Lightning Rod  did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for  Hidden Power . In  Generations 3-5 , this ability's name was formatted as  Lightningrod .

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: Sturdy  allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). If  Sturdy  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as  Fury Swipes ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy  does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as  Selfdestruct ,  Explosion  and  Final Gambit .

abilities.name: Weak Armor
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with  Weak Armor  is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

abilities.name: Sand Stream
abilities.description: Sand Stream  creates a sandstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  Air Lock  or  Cloud Nine  or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities ( Sand Stream ,  Drizzle ,  Drought  or  Snow Warning ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to  Generation 6 ,  Sand Stream  lasts indefinitely upon activation. No Pokémon have  Sand Stream  as a hidden ability.

abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Regenerator  restores  1 ⁄ 3  of its maximum HP when switching out.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: Guts  raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

abilities.name: Sheer Force
abilities.description: Sheer Force  increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects. Beneficial  effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as: Non-beneficial effects, that  Sheer Force  will not activate for, include: If the user is holding a  Life Orb  and uses an attack that activates  Sheer Force , it will not receive the 10% damage from  Life Orb , but it gets boosts from both  Life Orb  and  Sheer Force  (total of 69% base power increase). Flamethrower  normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With  Sheer Force , Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn. Note that if a move has an advantageous  and  disadvantageous side-effect,  Sheer Force  still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example,  Flare Blitz  may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with  Sheer Force  using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn. Here are the moves that increase in power under  Sheer Force , listed alphabetically:

abilities.name: Prankster
abilities.description: Prankster  increases the priority of status moves by +1. This means that a slower Pokémon with  Prankster  can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like  Aqua Jet . The move  Quick Guard  does not block moves whose priority is increased by  Prankster  (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).

abilities.name: Infiltrator
abilities.description: Infiltrator  ignores the effects of  Reflect ,  Light Screen  and  Safeguard . In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard,  Toxic  would still badly poison them.

 No Pokémon have  Mummy  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Solid Rock
abilities.description: Solid Rock  reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. For example, a Water-type move used against a Rock-type Pokémon with  Solid Rock  would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×. No Pokémon have  Solid Rock  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: Sturdy  allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves ( Fissure ,  Horn Drill ,  Guillotine  or  Sheer Cold ). If  Sturdy  activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as  Fury Swipes ), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy  does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as  Selfdestruct ,  Explosion  and  Final Gambit .

abilities.name: Defeatist
abilities.description: When the HP of a Pokémon with  Defeatist  falls below 50%, its Attack and Special Attack stats are halved. No Pokémon have  Defeatist  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Stench
abilities.description: A Pokémon with  Stench  has a 10% chance of causing the opponent to flinch when hit by a damaging move (provided the ability-bearer strikes first as usual). Stench  does not stack with the items  King's Rock  or  Razor Fang , so an ability-bearer holding either item will keep the flinch chance at 10%. In  Generations 3-4 ,  Stench  has no effect in battle. If a Pokémon with  Stench  is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

abilities.name: Sticky Hold
abilities.description: Sticky Hold  prevents held items from being taken or switched. If a Pokémon with  Sticky Hold  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases.

abilities.name: Weak Armor
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with  Weak Armor  is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

abilities.name: Illusion
abilities.description: When a Pokémon with the  Illusion  ability switches into battle, it takes the form of the Pokémon in last place (6th) of the player's party.  Illusion  will not activate if the Pokémon in last place is the same species or is fainted. The effect is aesthetic only;  Illusion  does not change the Pokémon's type or moves, so for example a  Fighting -type move against a  Zoroark  disguised as  Gengar  would still be super effective. Any direct attack (i.e. not entry hazards, weather conditions etc) will  break the illusion . No Pokémon have  Illusion  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Cute Charm
abilities.description: If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability  Oblivious . Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being  immobilized by love  each turn and unable to attack. If a Pokémon with  Cute Charm  is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is  2 ⁄ 3 .

abilities.name: Technician
abilities.description: Technician  increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%. Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if  Magnitude  hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power. Moves like  Sonic Boom  that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by  Technician .

abilities.name: Snow Warning
abilities.description: Snow Warning  creates a hailstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via  Air Lock  or  Cloud Nine  or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities ( Snow Warning ,  Drizzle ,  Drought  or  Sand Stream ) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to  Generation 6 ,  Snow Warning  lasts indefinitely upon activation.

abilities.name: Telepathy
abilities.description: Pokémon with the  Telepathy  ability will not take damage from teammates in double and triple battles. This affects moves such as  Surf  and  Earthquake , which normally hit all Pokémon on the field apart from the user.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with  Synchronize , the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on. In  Generations 3-4 , bad poison is only passed on as regular poison. If a Pokémon with  Synchronize  is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature. No Pokémon have  Synchronize  as a hidden ability.

abilities.name: Mold Breaker
abilities.description: Mold Breaker  prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the  Mold Breaker  Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves. For example, a  Haxorus  with  Mold Breaker  would be able to hit a  Bronzong  (having  Levitate ) using a Ground type move like  Earthquake . Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types. However, if  Dragon Claw  KOs a Pokémon with  Aftermath , a  Mold Breaker  Pokémon would still lose HP as Aftermath did not affect the  Dragon Claw  attack itself.
